required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Project Healthy Eating in Children. A Study on the Health Effects of Fish Intake in Overweight Children
clinical_study.official_title: Title in Norwegian: Ung og Frisk. En Studie av Helseeffekter av Fiskeinntak i Overvektige Barn.

brief_summary.textblock: It has previously been seen that increased fish intake improves the metabolic health of overweight and obese adults, and animal protein improved metabolic health of obese rats. In this project the investigators will investigate whether increased intake of fish or meat improve metabolic health in children aged 9-12 years as well when replacing processed food. The hypothesis is that increased intake of unprocessed fish or meat will improve metabolic health in children as measured by glucose tolerance, lipid metabolism and inflammatory markers.

clinical_study.why_stopped: We were unable to recruit a sufficient number of participants

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in metabolic status (glucose, lipids, inflammation)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and end of intervention period (12 weeks)
primary_outcome.description: We will investigate any changes in the metabolic status by analyzing parameters affected by changes in glucose homeostasis, lipid metabolism and inflammation.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and end of intervention (12 weeks)

arm_group.description: Participants will eat 75 - 150 grams of salmon for dinner, three times a week for 12 weeks.
Participants will eat 75-150 grams of cod for dinner, three times a week for 12 weeks.
Participants will eat 75-150 grams of mixed meat for dinner, three times a week for 12 weeks.

intervention.description: The children are advised to eat at least 75g of salmon per serving, but no more than 150g
The children are advised to eat at least 75g of cod per serving, but no more than 150g
The children are advised to eat at least 75g of meat per serving, but no more than 150g

study_pop.textblock: Cildren aged 9-12 years are invited to participate in the study. The children must be healthy and not use prescription medications that affects lipid metabolism, glucose regulation or the immunesystem.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- overweight (iso-BMI > 25)
- 9-12 years
- healthy
Exclusion Criteria:
- diagnosed diseases such as diabetes, CVD, intestinal diseases, arthritis
- prescription medications affecting the metabolism of glucose, lipids or the immune system
- use of supplements containing long chain n-3 fatty acids
- high intake of fish
- food allergy
